snippet: Gov. Pete Wilson's budding Presidential campaign may have suffered some damage since it was disclosed on Wednesday that he once employed an undocumented Mexican maid and failed to pay her Social Security taxes.   But the Governor's top aides, alon...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pete Wilson's budding Presidential campaign may have suffered some damage since it was disclosed on Wednesday that he once employed an undocumented Mexican maid and failed to pay her Social Security taxes. But the Governor's top aides, along with leading fellow Republicans, and even many top Democrats, said today that the damage caused by those disclosures, while serious, was not sufficient to force Mr. Wilson to quit the 1996 race.

headline.main: Wilson's '96 Drive Is Bruised but Alive
